content.description: Move easily up and left toward the arete till the pockets run out. Paw at the arete with your left hand and set your feet to bust the big move to the sidepull way up and around the arete. A couple more insecure moves gains a good horizontal and easier climbing to the top. Problem would get 3 stars if it was not squeezed in a corner making you feel like you're going to hit stuff if you blow it, though you shouldn't hit anything.
content.location: The arete at the left end of the face that houses My Heart Grew Wings Over Desert Skies.

content.description: On the far left of the North facing side, left of Grotesque Old Woman, start on pockets and climb up hidden holds to gain the left arete and top out.
content.protection: A few pads and a spotter.
content.location: Left of Grotesque Old Woman in the Desert Skies Area.

climbs.name: This Is How We Do It...

content.description: Thin, reachy moves down low lead to a balancy, technical  section high off the ground.
content.location: On the large boulder left of Every Color You Are

content.description:
Highball.

Stand-start high with good edges on the vertical wall.  Make a big stretch up and right to a big square-cut sidepull, and head up on edges, OR go straight up from the starting holds on crimps and sidepulls.  Slightly easier moves lead up to the safety of the big horizontal crack at 25 feet, followed by a few more feet of easy ground.  The opening sequences feel like the physical crux, but you get off the deck real quick on this thing and the moves continue to be committing.  Very heady, keep it togetha!
content.location: Up canyon a short distance from 'Morning Dove White'

content.description:
Tall and sharp.

Climb the left side of the wall using sharp edges, dishes and pockets.  Not as good as it's neighbor to the right, but you might as well climb it while you're there...
content.location: Left side of the 'Tall Wall', just to the right of the off-width separating the 'Tall Wall' and the next boulder.

climbs.name: Take the Force of the Blow

content.description: Start with fingers at head height.    Make a hard pull to gain a hold up and right.    Press on through here to better holds above.

climbs.name: My Heart Grew Wings Under Desert Skies

content.description:
A fine boulder problem with a stiff start, a nice rest and an exciting finish.

Start with pockets down low under the giant, obvious hueco.  Use pockets and edges to make a couple stout moves to gain the jug in the giant hueco (crux).  Move up on edges and jugs to the topout.  Don't pull too hard above the big hueco, as the holds may be loose, some are hollow and it's fairly high.
content.location:
A short stroll along the rim down-canyon from

Morning Dove White

.  It's hard to miss the giant hueco - easily seen from the canyon floor.

content.description: Pockets.  Start on the lowest pockets just right of the vertical seam.  Traverse left on pockets, then up to a hard move to and from a bad crimp, and continue up to the horizontal crack and easier ground.
content.location:
The obvious, overhanging pockety face.  Look for the thin horizontal crack about 10 feet off the ground.  Just up-canyon from

My Heart Grew Wings...

content.description:
A great problem that leads you into temptation.

Start with hands in good pockets. Rock up and over left with a tricky move to gain a thin flake for the left hand. Balance your way up the wall to gain the small slots.

With fingers in the slots launch for the good lip.

https://www.youtube.com/LRLvhuM_9NI
A stellar traverse.  Start on the right side of the wall under 'My Heart Grew Wings...' and traverse left on pockets to finish up on 'Wills' Arete'.  Very pumpy.  Feels like a 5.13 route for sure.
Start with fingers in pockets.  Move up and slightly left passing two shallow sidepulls.
content.location: Left of center on the steep thin wall.

content.description:
An awesome two move power problem!

Sit start on two sloper crimps. Pull on and use what core you have to keep your feet on the wall. Make a hard toss left hand to a sloper on the lip, keep your feet on and dyno up right to another sloper. Use the foot cut to your advantage and swing a toe to a big foot out right. Come in for the match and top her out.

Better than it looks! Cool weather might be helpful..
content.location: From Morning Dove White, spin around and locate the short overhang.

content.description:
Crouch start on the left side of the prow.   Follow good finger pockets to a long move to gain a good hold above the lip.   Match on this and traverse right passing a deep slot/crack.   Continue right with a hard sequence of moves to pull up and right to gain the good deep flake.

Finish direct.
content.location:
On the prow left of

Mister Witty

.

content.description: The direct version to morning dove white. Hang start on bad pockets and either campus or use very poor feet to get to a left hand mono. Squeeze two fingers in if you can! Set feet and make a big move right to a good pocket. Make a heinous cross to another pocket and continue up and finish as for morning dove white.
